name: Hotel Presidente

reviews.text: El Presidente really surpassed all my expectations. From the outside the hotel does not look like much but once you go inside absolutely beautiful. The daytime staff were truly amazing, especially "Jorge" who always greeted us with a smile. Thank you soo very much El Presidente for an AMAZING Visit.
reviews.title: Great Downtown Hotel

reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: buyer beware

reviews.text: 1. Beautiful cozy room….that provided my daughter and I with a great nights rest.
reviews.title: A Place to Return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Staff was excellent in helping my daughter and I figure out which tours would be best for us to take.
reviews.title: Downtown Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Tour desk was amazing
reviews.title: Perfect hotel in the middle of San Jose
Downtown San Jose
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice especially during the daytime. Right in the heart of Avenida Central, there are food stalls, shopping, museums, and bars all in walking distance. Nightime is another story. The hotel's amenities were lovely, as well as free wi-fi in the lobby area. Great place to stay to see history, shop, and see the true downtown of san jose.

No complaints at all. Very helpful staff, good room--clean, everything worked--and cannot beat the location for walking around Central San Jose. Museums, banks, central market, post office and lots of restaurants all within a few blocks. I was traveling with my 78 yr old mother, so safety and convenience were very important. Was impressed that when I was using wireless in lobby, staff at bar brought over ice water even though I didn't order anything.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Presidente for two nights at the end of our trip to Costa Rica. We were upgraded to a suite when we checked in, and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel Presidente is in a great location for walking around and sightseeing in downtown San Jose. The hotel is very secure, and we felt safe and comfortable. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a perfect place to get some rest and explore San Jose.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Presidente for one night after arriving at San Jose airport for our 10 day adventure in CR. Our room was as big as an apartment! We got the junior suite which offered a king sized bed, a long dresser, with a refrigerator. A computer desk located right in front of a window overlooked the pedestrian walk. There was a LARGE living area, with a table and two chairs for dining. We had a small balcony, about 6-8 inches, haha, but nice that the door opened up and we could stand out there and watch all the activity down below on the street.
reviews.title: Great room, great view, perfect location!

reviews.text: The staff was super nice, and I loved that a guard stood outside to make sure no one wandered in that shouldn't be there. The breakfast was great and was our first experience with real Tico food :) We thought it was pretty strange to eat beans and rice for breakfast, but we ate it every day and got used to that real fast. They offer an omelet bar too, in addition to fruit and breads and a couple of other hot foods.
reviews.title: Convenient location, friendly service, nice room and delicious breakfast

reviews.text: Staying here was a last minute addition to our trip but I'm actually quite glad to have had the opportunity to experience the San Jose culture and the friendly people at Hotel Presidente!
reviews.title: Excellent value and friendly staff! Why stay anywhere else in San Jose?

reviews.text: First, finding the place was a little challenging even with GPS and my friend used to live in SJ! If you're driving there a few things you need to know: #1) BR aware of the outrageous hold of funds on your credit card by the rental car companies (US$2000-$3500). #2) The roads are not in the best condition but reasonable. However, be prepared for crazy stuff like bus stops on the highway and cars to come right into your lane at any moment! #3) When you make it into SJ you will go to Calle 7 and Central Ave. the main entrance to the hotel is on central ave which is for pedestrians only. There is a side entrance off Calle 7 (7th street) but it isn't marked very well. There is a small white sign on the wall that says "Hotel Presidente Private Parking".
reviews.title: Oasis in a not so pleasant city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other than that I have no criticism for anything else! The staff is all delightful and helpful! You can make change at the hotel for virtually the same exchange rate as the banco. They have complimentary umbrellas if it begins to rain.. The breakfast buffet was really great and they will even cook to order pancakes, fried eggs, or omlette. The room is very comfortable and modern. The bed was a little harder than I prefer but still did not keep me from sleeping through the night! Also, even though it was a Friday night and there was activity around the area outside, I didn't hear any noise while in the room. Last, the exercise room had decent equipment and a pretty good view of the city and mountains (7th floor).
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel for the Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've stayed at hotels around the world and this is one of my favorites! By the way, it should be mentioned that San Jose is a BUSY and dirty city. However, I didn't experience any situation where I felt unsafe. I would not recommend you let down your guard because I'm sure there are bad people waiting to pounce but overall the people seemed generally friendly everywhere. Lastly, tipping isn't required because servers get paid a service charge. If you tip it should be small ($1-$2).
reviews.title: The staff at this hotel are the world class

reviews.text: I stayed overnight at the Hotel Presidente while on my way back from Manuel Antonio National Park in Costa Rica. After a week at the beach, experiencing the "Pura Vida" attitude and falling in love with the natural beauty of Costa Rica, I had to spend a night in San Jose before my flight home. Needless to say, coming into central San Jose after a week at the beach was a huge shock to the system. San Jose is dirty, slightly dangerous, and not very pleasant. But the Hotel Presidente helped to make my night in San Jose enjoyable and comfortable. First, it's incredibly central, which makes it easy to get to by cab and also easy to go out to grab a quick bite to eat. The hotel staff were very cautious about my friend and I going anywhere on foot at night, citing safety concerns, so we easily stayed close to the hotel with their recommendations. The next morning before my flight, I was able to easily and quickly do a little walking tour of San Jose to see the major sites - all within a few minutes of the hotel. Also, the staff were very accomodating and nice - and all spoke excellent English. The breakfast that is included was a nice touch, and the beds were incredibly comfortable. It was also great to have a nice TV with cable for a night after "roughing it" in the jungle. It helps to have a place to chill out when you don't feel super comfortable wandering the city at night and have some time to kill. The only downside is that the wifi is only accessible in the lobby, and to be fair the decor is a bit bland. It's definitely not a boutique hotel, but for what you'll get in San Jose, it's tops. And hey, it's a great price and you get a lot for your money. Definitely recommended for the (hopefully short) amount of time you have to stay in San Jose.
reviews.title: Among the Best Downtown Choices if Downtown is What You Want

reviews.text: We spent 1 night at this hotel before our flight home. We had about a half day to explore SJ and wanted something central and nice. This hotel fit the bill perfectly. Our stay at this hotel topped off a great trip to CR and we left the country with nothing but great memories. We WILL return - to CR and to this hotel.
reviews.title: Good for exploring central SJ

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the outside, the hotel doesn't look like much and we are glad that the shuttle driver knew where he was going - we don't think we would have found it on our own. One entrance faces the pedestrian street, the other is sort of a back entrance for cars. There aren't any large signs or anything outside to really let you know where the hotel is. Once inside though, the hotel is very nice. The open-air lobby is very comfortable. The bar and cafe are there too. It was a nice place to sit and relax, check internet, plan some sightseeing, etc.
reviews.title: Centrally Located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was great - the people at the check-in desk, in the bar and restaurant, and the doormen all took very good care of us. We really couldn't ask for better service. In fact, I have to say that just about everybody working in the tourist industry that we dealt with in CR was great - extremely helpful, gracious, upbeat.
reviews.title: A nice relaxing oasis.

reviews.text: Our room was very well-done - comfortable, nice decor, very clean. My only wish would be for a full-sized mirror and maybe a make-up mirror in the bathroom. The addition of those two items would make the room perfect. Wifi throughout the hotel would be good too - they have it in the lobby (free) but not in the rooms.
reviews.title: Good Place to Start Your Trip
Nice hotel, good location
reviews.text: This hotel is located in the center of the city. It is a great location for selecting restaurants, bars and tourist sites in San Jose. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and the rooms are clean. If your room is located facing the pedestrian mall and you are a light sleeper, you might be disturbed by the pedestrian traffic outside.There is a secure parking lot and security and security monitors who comes into the hotel, especially at night.

description: An iconic landmark in San Jose, Costa Rica, Hotel Presidente is a contemporary urban retreat in the heart of downtown San Jose. With its vibrant ambiance, modern décor and great service, our 4-star upscale hotel is the symbol of hospitality and the cultural soul Costa Rica's capital city. Celebrated for our eco-friendly tourism practices, Hotel Presidente is a window into Costa Rica's land, people and heritage. Experience an unforgettable vacation adventure, romantic getaway or business trip at Hotel Presidente... the place to relax, connect, inspire, dine, and explore Costa Rica!
